rbac_patch:
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: over-perm
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources: ["pods", "pods/log", "services", "endpoints"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
- apiGroups: ["apps"]
  resources: ["deployments", "replicasets"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
podsec_patch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: ReplicaSet
metadata:
  name: nginx-79d94c948b
  namespace: demo
spec:
  template:
    spec:
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
        seccompProfile:
          type: RuntimeDefault
      containers:
        - name: nginx
          securityContext:
            allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
            capabilities:
              drop: ["ALL"]
            readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
            runAsUser: 1000
summary: The Pod's ServiceAccount has overly permissive ClusterRole bindings. The ClusterRole grants wildcard access to all resources and verbs. The ClusterRole is updated to restrict access to specific resources (pods, services, endpoints, deployments, replicasets) and verbs (get, list, watch). The Pod's security context is hardened to align with Pod Security Standards (restricted profile): setting runAsNonRoot, seccompProfile, dropping capabilities, and readOnlyRootFilesystem.
